loans.name: Ramón Donato

texts.es:
El señor Ramón esta solicita un préstamo para remodelación de un cuarto, ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material que es  bock, arena y cemento.
Con esta construcción podrá disfrutar de sus alimentos ya que cuentan con una cuarto pequeño, el cual utilizan como cocina pero se encuentra en malas condiciones, y en esta época de lluvia y frio tiene problemas y quieren evitar enfermedades, ya que son personas mayores de edad. 
Don Ramón es una persona pensionada y aparte realiza trabajos de construcción en diferentes partes de la ciudad. Y su esposa la señora Rosa se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida que es tamales y tacos, es para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Ramón is requesting a loan to remodel a room as he doesn't have the money he needs to buy materials such as blocks, sand and cement.  By carrying out this building work, he will be able to enjoy his meals as he currently has a small room which he uses as a kitchen and it is in a bad state of repair.  During this cold, rainy season, he experiences problems.  He would like to avoid getting sick as he and his wife are both elderly.

Ramón is a pensioner who also carries out building work in different parts of the city.  His wife, Rosa, makes and sells food such as tamales and tacos in order to help her husband with the family expenses.

loans.use: to remodel a room that he uses as a kitchen / dining room

loans.name: Ivannia Yorleny

texts.es:
Ivannia tiene 34 años de edad, el cual vive con su familia, en  la Fuente, en la provincia de Cartago. El principal sistema de drenaje de esta zona es el río Reventazón que nace en el Cerro Cuericí. Por la fertilidad de sus suelos volcánicos y aluviales, Cartago es el centro de población que tiene en la agricultura y ganadería sus principales fuentes económicas.
Desde hace varios meses que Ivannia se dedica a la secretaria de esta empresa de crédito. Pero en estos momentos, le falta esta herramienta tecnológica para que su negocio surja y para que los socios se vean beneficiados.  
Actualmente Ivannia está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones) para  comprar una computadora portátil, para que haya más calidad en el servicio al cliente, ya que la demanda cada vez es grande y para la Empresa piueda hacer los informes y llevar la contabilidad de dicha organización. Para que asi continúe creciendo esta empresa y  siga ayudando a los vecinos de la comunidad. 

Ivannia es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Fuente Agrícola, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Ivannia is 34 years old, and lives with her family in La Fuente, in the province of Cartago. The main drainage system in the area is the Reventazón river which originates from Cerro Cuericí. Due to its fertile and alluvial volcanic soils, Cartago is the population center. The inhabitants depend on agriculture and livestock as their main source of income.

For several months Ivannia has working for the administrative department in the community bank. She lacks the technological tools to make the business grow and to benefit the members. 

Currently, Ivannia is seeking a loan for ¢ 500,000 (five hundred thousand colones) to purchase a laptop so that higher quality customer service can be provided. Demand is ever-increasing and she needs to make reports and do the accounts for the organization. She needs the loan to continue to successfully grow the business and continue to assist community residents.

Ivannia is a member of the 'Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Fuente Agrícola' (Fuente Agricultural Community Loans), one of the 150 organizations that are members of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan and with it she hopes to continue growing both personally and financially, as well as participating actively in the organization of credit in her community.

loans.use: to purchase a computer for the company

loans.name: Nahwand

texts.en:
Nahwand is a conservative person, and for that reason she asked her son, Majdi, to replace her in the photo. Nahwand, 54 years old and a married woman, has three sons and daughters. Her husband works In the tailoring business. Nahwand also works in the same field, so they established a workshop and added a few machines to it and started their business almost a year ago. 

Now Nahwand has applied for a loan to buy more sewing machines and other needed tools.

loans.use: to buy more sewing machines and other needed tools.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is a 65-year-old man, married and a father of five children. He lives in Aden, Yemen. He has a grocery store which has been operating for 12 years. He started his business with limited capital that qualified him to open a grocery. He has some regular customers and is quite preferred in the area because he always strives to keep a variety of products in his store so that his customers will always find what they are looking for. 

Lately, he’s noticed that competition has become quite fierce so he’s decided to take the situation in hand because this business is his main source of income and he always wants to stay one step ahead of his competition.

Based on this, he’s made the decision to invest in his business buying merchandise wholesale so that he can have the store well-stocked with a variety of products that will help him to keep his clientele and to attract new customers.

 Because he does not have the necessary economic resources to invest in the business, he's decided to request a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB. With this loan he’ll buy a variety of products for the grocery like: sugar, beans, rice, cookies, candy, soft drinks, sweet bread and other products that will allow him to attract new customers. 

In the future, Saleh hopes his family will attain better living conditions and he’ll be able to maintain his business for a long time.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products for the grocery like:  sugar, beans, rice, cookies, candy, soft drinks, sweet bread and other products for his business.

loans.name: Naela

texts.en:
Naela is a 39-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Naela has a beauty salon and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase cosmetic products to sell at her salon.

Naela is looking to expand her project and adding a section for selling a wedding gowns.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products to sell at her salon.

loans.name: Majeeda

texts.en:
Majeeda refused to have her picture uploaded on the internet due to cultural issues, so the man in the photo is her brother-in-law's son.

Majeeda is a 31-year-old married woman from Bani Kenanah, Irbid, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Majeeda has an interesting project: she breeds bees in beehives and she is requesting a loan of 800 JD to to increase her beehives and the production of honey.

Majeeda is looking to move her project into a bigger place so that she can increase the number of beehives and thus the amount of honey her bees produce.

an aspiration of Majjeda's is to improve her family's living conditions and improve their living standard.

loans.use: to increase her beehives and the production of honey.

loans.name: Samiah

texts.en:
Samiah is a 47-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of five children.

Samiah  has a home-based project through which she sells clothes and she is requesting a loan of 1200 JD to purchase more quantities of clothes to sell.

Samiah is looking to open a shop for her products so that she can increase her customer base and improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for business purposes.

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en:
Hanadi refused to have her picture uploaded on the internet so the man in the photo is Hanadi's husband named Asa'ad.

Hanadi is a 30-year-old woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan.

Hanadi is making basket-making and embroidery and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase raw materials needed.

Hanadi is looking to improve her business and increase her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials needed such as thread, fabrics, straw, etc.

loans.name: Wedad

texts.en:
Wedad is a 50-year-old woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Wedad is looking to improve her living conditions thus she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to do maintenance on her house with an aspiration of increasing her family's living standards.

loans.use: to do home maintenance.

loans.name: Khawlah

texts.en:
Khawlah is a 60-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of two children.

Khawlah is selling clothes and blankets and she works from home. Khawlah is requesting a loan of 900 JD to purchase clothes and blankets for business purposes.

Khawlah is looking to improve her family's social and financial conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and blankets for business purposes.

loans.name: Rehab

texts.en:
Rehab is a 53-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Rehab is a tailor and she is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to purchase a sewing machine and some raw materials needed.

Rehab is looking to open a workshop so that she can increase her production and thus increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and some raw materials.

loans.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola is a 40-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and she has five children.

Ola has a home-based project through which she sells cosmetics and perfumes thus she is requesting a loan of 900 JD to purchase cosmetic products and perfumes for business purposes.

Ola is looking to open a store for her products so that she can increase her customer base.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and perfumes for business purposes.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 36-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of eight children.

Amal started her business producing dairy products years ago and now she has more than one sheep.

Amal is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to  purchase milk and sheep for making dairy products. She is looking to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase milk and sheep for making dairy products.

loans.name: Suhair

texts.en:
Suhair is 31 years old, a married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of one child.

Suhair is looking to improve her family's living conditions thus she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to do home maintenance.

loans.use: to do home maintenance.

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Ahlam is a 40-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of five children.

Ahlam  is looking to improve her family's living conditions thus she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to do home maintenance.

loans.use: to do home maintenance.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 35-year-old man from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan.

Ali is requesting a loan of 800 JD to purchase home appliances and paint his house.

Ali is newly married and he is looking to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase home appliances and paint the house.

loans.name: Aliah

texts.en:
Aliah is a 37-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children.

Aliah is requesting a loan of 500 JD to do home maintenance with an aspiration of improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to do home maintenance.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 32-year-old single man from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan.

Hussein is a tailor and he works in a workshop. Hussein is  requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase a sewing machine to use at his home so that he can work on his own when he gets back home after work.

Hussien is looking to improve his family's living conditions and improve their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en: Isaiah is 36 years old, married with one child, age 12. He does motorcycle transport to earn a living. He has been in the business for 3 years and describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Isaiah has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 80,000 KES to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita is 60 years old and married with 10 children.

Leonita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store. Leonita has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 9 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Leonita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda is 47 years old and married with 4 children. She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Nilda is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell. Nilda has been buying and selling livestock for one year and also earns additional income from a sari-sari store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi is a married woman. She has 2 children and both are enrolled in school. Her husband works as a businessman. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity.

Bintihamisi operates a food stall and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for 2 years. Her primary customers are her neighbors. She describes her greatest business challenge to be transportation and her highest monthly expense is food for her family. Bintihamisi will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase more stocks of rice, beans, wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil for her business. Bintihamisi aspires to establish a retail shop in the future. She joined Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rice, beans, wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Rosedelma

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Rosedelma works hard to support her family. She has a bakery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from furniture making. Rosedelma is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her bakery business. 

Rosedelma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery production business

loans.name: Manteleur Bloc 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Manteleur Bloc 2   est créé en  2008 à  l’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de 15 femmes qui vivent dans le même quartier. Très déterminées à mener des activités génératrices de revenus.  Elles évoluent toutes dans le petit commerce.

Madame  Fatoumata,  (assise à l’extrême droite et levant la main), est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 51 ans, est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle évolue dans la transformation de patte d’arachide, elle vend aussi d’huile de palm pendant la saison de récolte.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter des graines d’arachide destinées à la transformation en patte en vu de la vente.

Avec les bénéfices réalisés, elle compte aider son mari dans la prise en charges des besoins  familiaux.
texts.en:
Manteleur Bloc 2 Group was established in 2008, when the Banc Villageois was inaugurated. It is made up of fifteen women who live in the same neighborhood. They are all retailers and very much determined to run money earning business.

Mrs. Fatoumata (raising her hand and sitting on the far right in the photograph) is responsible for the group. She's 51 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She makes peanut paste, and also sells palm oil during the harvest season.

She intends to use this loan to buy peanuts to transform into peanut paste to sell. She will use her profits to help her husband in taking care of her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy peanuts to transform into peanut paste to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is married and has one child. Avelina is 49 years old. She lives in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Avelina owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting bananas for sale to earn a living. She's been 15 years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

In 2011, Avelina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Avelina wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 64 years old and married with 5 children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Sarah is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Sarah has been farming vegetables for 8 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is from Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Fely is married and has four children. 

To make a living, Fely is operating a retail business, selling a variety of food and home used products in the local community. Fely has been in her business for 8 years and earns 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Fely is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. Recently this year, Fely joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a businessman. He sells cooking gas cylinders to earn a living. He has been in the business for 3 years and has employed one person.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy cooking gas cylinders to sell.

loans.use: to buy cooking gas cylinders to sell

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is applying for another loan to expand her existing business. She will use this 35,000 KES loan to purchase more bundles of Kikois (traditional African cloth used as clothing) and clothes for resale. In the future, Mwanasiti aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Mwanasiti has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of Kikois and clothes for resale

loans.name: Merie Ann

texts.en: Merie Ann lives in Bañadero, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old and single, and earns a living by running a farm and selling food she makes on a barbeque. Both of her businesses are successful, and she is applying for a new loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. She hopes that this loan will help her increase her farm's output.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 33 years old and the mother of one child. For the last six years, he has earned a living by running a beauty salon and now has four employees. Since joining Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to enjoy financial stability in the future. She is applying for a loan for 40,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a hair dryer to use in her salon.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 38 years old and married with three children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and works hard to provide for her family. She has been running this general store for 18 years, and she also earns an income from raising pigs. 

Wilma requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock for her store. She has previously borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF.

Wilma aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en: Mathew is 47 years old, married and has three children. For the last five years, he has earned a living by selling food such as tea and loaves of bread. He now has two employees, and joined Faulu Kenya to continue growing his business. He is applying for a loan for 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy more sugar, tea leaves and milk to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy sugar, tea and milk to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Oscar William

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 41 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de nazca, ciudad ciudad muy activa, debido a la afluencia de turistas que visitan a diario las milenarias Líneas de Nazca, y también por y también por el desarrollo en auge minero, agrícola y comercial de la zona, que la están convirtiendo en unas de las ciudades más cosmopolitas del sur peruano; Oscar le gusta mucho nuestra comida y por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es el “Lomo Saltado”, en sus tiempos libres le gusta mucho escuchar música sobre todo cuando tiene algún problema o esta de mal humor ya que lo relaja mucho, el solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria. Oscar es casado y junto a sus esposa tiene 2 maravillosos hijos cuyas edades comprenden 9 y 7 años y ambos cursan estudios primarios, el los adora mucho y son el motor de su vida sin ellos el no sería nada nos comenta porque es el regalo más grande que le ha dado Dios.

Oscar trabaja ofreciendo el servicio de taxi a los pobladores de su ciudad, el recorre las calles en busca de pasajeros a quien ofrecer sus servicios, trabaja alrededor de 8 horas y puede atender hasta 20 pasajeros diariamente, pero cuando es un día festivo puede atender hasta 50 clientes, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque trabaja con todas sus fuerzas para salir adelante y por darle lo mejor a sus familia.

Oscar está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva porque con la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento a su vehículo, lo que le permitirá manejar de una manera más segura con un vehículo sin averías, así sus clientes estarán más seguros y tendrán más confianza en usar sus servicios, con esta mejora tendrá mas ingresos y podra seguir ahorrando para cumplir su más grande sueño:”Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y comprarse otro vehículo”.
texts.en:
Oscar is 41 years old and lives in the city of Nazca.  This is a very active city, because of the influx of tourists who come daily to see the ancient Nazca Lines.  It is also a city that is seeing increasing mining, farming and commercial activities, which are turning this area into one of the most cosmopolitan cities in the southern part of Peru.  Oscar really enjoys the Peruvian cuisine; one of his favorite dishes is the "Lomo Saltado" (a traditional Peruvian beef dish.)  In his free time, he really enjoys listening to music, most of all when he has a problem or is in a bad mood, because this relaxes him.  Oscar only has a 5th grade education, but he would have liked to have gotten a university degree.  Oscar is married, and with his wife he has 2 wonderful children, aged 9 and 7, who are both in elementary school.  He really adores them, and they are the driving force behind his life.  He says that without them, he would be nothing, because they are the greatest gift that God has given him.

Oscar works providing taxi services to the residents of his city.  He goes around the streets looking for passengers to whom he can offer his services.  He works about 8 hours a day, during which time he provides services to up to 20 passengers.  But when it is a festival day, he can service up to 50 customers.  He believes that his business is doing well because of all the effort he puts in so that he can get ahead and provide the best for his family.

Oscar is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because with their help he will be able to do maintenance work on his vehicle.  This will permit him to drive a safer vehicle and avoid having it malfunction.  In this way his customers will be safer and will have more confidence in using his services.  With this improvement, he will have more income and will be able to save toward his main dreams, which are "to provide a good education to his children and to buy himself another vehicle."

loans.use: to do maintenance work on his taxi

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is married with two children; he is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Rolando provides transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for five years, and every month he earns 15,625 PHP for his work. He has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to renovate his motorcab so that he can provide better service.

Rolando has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Rolando hopes to help his children finish their education and to double the income of his business.

loans.use: to renovate his motorcab.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is married and the mother of three children. She is 35 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Jesusa used her last loan to purchase assorted fish to sell. Since then, her business has grown and become successful. 

Now Jesusa is taking out a new loan to purchase food and drinks to sell. She is hopeful that her business will continue to grow.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her food vending business.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy, 34 years old, is married and the father of four children aged 7, 5 and 2. He is a boda boda (motorcycle transport) operator and also owns a car wash. Kennedy has been in this business for four years and earns a monthly income of KES 13,000.

Kennedy has requested a loan of KES 10,000 to buy a washing machine and to boost his wife's business. He would use any profit he gets from his business to educate his children and buy a plot of land. Kennedy's dreams are to expand his business and provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase a washing machine and to boost his wife's business

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en: Cheryl is a 35-year-old married woman who lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has four school-aged children. Cheryl is now raising corn and goats, earning a monthly income of 3,000 PHP from these activities. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers for the corn crops she raises.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for the corn crops

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a businessman who provides car transportation to earn a living. He has been in this business for 6 years and describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since George joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income. He hopes to expand his business in the future. George has applied for a loan of 100,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy tires for his car.

loans.use: To buy tires for his car

loans.name: Rahama

texts.en: Rahama is 30 years old, married and has five children, three of whom are in school. For the last three years, she has earned a living by selling food from a stall she owns in the town of Yambio, South Sudan. She is applying for this loan from BRAC South Sudan to buy beans and sugar to sell to her customers. She will use the extra income earned as a result of this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy beans and sugar to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Madelina

texts.en: Madelina is a 40-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. For the past two years, she has operated a food stall in Yambio, South Sudan. Madelina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice

loans.name: Chrisantus

texts.en:
Chrisantus is a 43-year-old hardworking man from Migori County, western Kenya. He is married to Magdaline, and they have three children between the ages of 12 and 25. 

Chrisantus operates a brick-making business in Migori, a business he has done for the last three years. He makes a monthly income of 5,000 KES. He has been awarded a fourth loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy raw materials such as firewood that he needs in order to make bricks. He will use the profits to pay back his loan.

His dream is to make more bricks so that he is able to meet his clients’ demand.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for brick-making

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is 43 years old, married, and has six children. She runs a retail shop to earn a living, which she has been doing for 10 years. Beth describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. She farms to earn extra income. 

Beth is requesting a loan for 90,000 KES, which she will use to buy maize flour, wheat flour, and sugar. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards. Beth hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Patrocinio

texts.en:
Patrocinio is from Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 31 years old and married with two children.

To make a living, Patrocinio owns and operates a tricycle transport service (a tricycle is a motorcycle with a passenger cab). Patrocinio has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for his work.

Patrocinio is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase spare parts and accessories for his vehicle.

In 2000, Patrocinio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation.
He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and accessories for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beans, wheat flour, backing flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en: Mwajuma is 34 years old, married and has six children, all of whom are enrolled in school. Her husband, Chamutu, is a businessman. For the last six years, Mwajuma has earned a living by selling charcoal out of her house. Most of her customers are neighbors and relatives. Her biggest challenge is transportation, and her main expenses are food and school fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped-in water. Mwajuma is applying for a loan for Kes 40,000 loan to buy more charcoal to sell to her customers. Her goal is to continue expanding her business. She joined Yehu because it has high-quality financial services.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jenty

texts.en: Jenty is a 36-year-old married woman with six children, four of whom are in school. For the past five years, she has operated a business selling fish in Yambio, South Sudan. Jenty is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale

loans.name: Christim

texts.en:
Christim has been operating her salon in Kangemi town for the last four years. She is 27 years old and married; she and her husband, Devans, have one child.

Christim was introduced to KADET, LTD by a friend who is also a KADET client. This is will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan amount to buy salon equipment and furnishings.

In the future, Christim hopes to expand her business and open another salon.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment and furnishings.

loans.name: Lucresia Argentina

texts.es:
Lucrecia, habitante  de la ciudad de León, de 62 años de edad,  casada madre de tres hijos todos ellos independientes, ella es comerciante desde hace 15 años . Tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, ella recuerda  que comenzó vendiendo refrescos naturales y pan dulce luego con financiamiento fue comprando productos para vender y cuando se dio cuenta ya tenia una pulpería que con muchos esfuerzo y duro trabajo ha ido creciendo poco a poco . Su esposo trabaja en un taller de soldadura y le ayuda con lo que gana. En base a esta actividad ambos ha criado y pagado la educación escolar de  sus hijos. 
Ella solicito el crédito para comprar útiles escolares y uniformes. Ya que la época escolar esta próxima a comenzar y sus clientes buscan estos artículos y las  ventas mejoran. Ella tiene la expectativa de seguir haciendo sostenible su negocio y hacerlo crecer cada dia.
texts.en:
62-year-old Lucrecia lives in the city of León.  She is married and has three children who all live independently.  Lucrecia has been a shopkeeper for 15 years.  She has a grocery store in her home.  She recalls that she started out selling natural soft drinks and sweet bread.  With financing, she bought more products to sell and built up a grocery store which she has been gradually growing with a lot of effort and hard work.  Her husband works in a metal shop and helps her with what he earns.  Through their joint work, the couple have raised their children and paid for their schooling.

Lucrecia requested this loan to buy school supplies and uniforms as the school term is about to start and her customers are looking for these products.  This is when her sales improve.  Lucrecia expects to continue making her business sustainable and to continue growing it every day.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and uniforms

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji is a 40-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba Nimule. She is married and has 6 children between the ages of 4 and 22, all of them in school. 

Keji has operated a small hotel and bar business for 3 years and has 1 employee. Keji heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients and outreach and promotion done by the loans officers. She is taking out a loan of 600 SDG to purchase drinks and more food items to be cooked. Apart from this business, Keji has no other source of income. 

In five years time, Keji hopes to have a big bar and restaurant and a good house. Her major challenges include home expenses, although her husband helps with a little support of cash. Keji says that she is happy for Finance South Sudan’s support which leads to women's empowerment.

loans.use: to purchase more food items and drinks.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 36 years old, married, and has five children.  He is from Migori town, West Kenya. His wife is in the farming business.

Nelson loves nature, which is why he sells tree seedlings. Nelson has been in this business for the three years and is able to earn a monthly income of 15,000 KES. 

Nelson is requesting his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy more tree species for sale. He will use his profits to repay his loan. His dream is to ensure that his family has a good standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of tree seedlings.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is a 30-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She has been selling charcoal in Yambio, South Sudan for three years.

Joice is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal for sale. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 22-year-old man from Migori Town, West Kenya. He and his wife, Rose, have no children yet.

Fredrick operates a motorcycle transport business, locally known as a bodaboda. He has been in this business for the last three years, making a monthly income of 20,000 KES. He has applied for his first loan from KADET, LTD, which he will use to buy a second-hand motorcycle and spare parts. He will use his profits to repay the loan.

Fredrick's dream is to ensure his family has the best living standards possible.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand motorcycle and spare parts.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Vive junto a su familia en el caserío Palominos, una zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima tropical caracterizado por la producción de frutas como el mango y el limón. La zona se encuentra ubicada en la región Piura, a cinco horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.
Se dedica desde hace más de tres años a la crianza y venta de ganado menor y aves de corral, ella cría estos animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estos se han desarrollado completamente los ofrece en venta. Su esposo se dedica a la venta de carne de pescado y pollo en una moto con la cual recorre su caserío y los alrededores. Con su arduo trabajo, ambos tratan de sacar adelante la economía de su familia.
Martha desea adquirir alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus animales y de ese modo venderlos a un mejor precio en el mercado local, esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio y así mejorar su calidad de vida. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
Ella ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa en el pasado y ha demostrado ser una cliente bastante responsable y puntual con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Martha is 36 years old.  She is married and has three children in her care.  She lives together with her family in the small village of Palominos, in a rural area of agricultural Tambogrande district.  This area has a tropical climate and is noted for its production of fruit such as mangoes and lemons.  The area is located in Piura region, five hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

For more than three years, Martha has been raising and selling livestock and farmyard birds.  She raises these animals in an area behind her home.  When they have grown, she offers them for sale.  Her husband's business is selling fish and chicken meat from a motorcycle that he uses to travel through their village and surrounding areas.  Through their hard work, the couple try to provide for their family financially.

Martha would like to buy nutritionally-balanced feed with which to feed her animals, so that she can fetch a better price for them in the local market.  This investment will allow her to continue growing her business and thereby improve her quality of life.  In order to achieve her goal, she decided to request a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Martha has taken out loans through Edpyme Alternativa in the past and has shown herself to be a responsible client who is punctual in making her repayments.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced feed with which to fatten her animals

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a 22-year-old single woman with no children. She has operated a food stall business in Yambio, South Sudan for one year. Catherine is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase rice and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga tiene 28 años de edad, es casada hace 12 años,, tiene  2 hijos de  de 11 y 2 años de edad, vive en la Aldea Santa Lucia, Naco, Cortes.
Olga tiene un negocio de pulpería desde hace 3 años, ella inicio su negocio con fondos propios mas la ayuda que le brindo su suegro, ofrece a sus clientes productos de la canasta básica, como manteca, azúcar, harina, arroz, huevos, golosinas y abarrotes, al cual le dedica todo el día.
Con la ayuda de varios prestamos ha mantenido surtido su negocio, actualmente solicita su quinto préstamo para poder abastecerse en comprar productos de abarrotería como jabón, papel, cal, escobas, productos de limpieza, etc.
Con esta inversión podrá obtener más ganancias y darle mejor condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Olga, 28, has been married for 12 years; she has two children who are 11 and 2 years old and she lives in the village of Santa Lucia in Naco, Cortes.

Olga has had a grocery store for three years.  She started it with her own funds plus help she got from her father-in-law.  She offers her customers basic staple items like lard, sugar, flour, rice, eggs, snacks and groceries; she works all day.

With help from various loans she’s kept her store stocked.  She’s currently asking for her fifth loan to be able to stock up buying such grocery items as soap, paper, lime powder, brooms, cleaning supplies, etc.  With this investment she’ll be able to earn more profits and provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Pilar

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos a su cargo. Vive junto a su familia en el caserío Monteverde, una zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima tropical caracterizado por la producción de frutas como el mango y el limón. La zona se encuentra ubicada en la región Piura, a cinco horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.
Se dedica desde hace más de cinco años a la crianza y venta de ganado menor y aves de corral, ella cría estos animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estos se han desarrollado completamente los ofrece en venta. Su esposo es agricultor y cuenta con una parcela propia en la cual tiene mango y maracuyá en producción.
Mercedes desea adquirir alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus animales y de ese modo venderlos a un mejor precio en el mercado local, esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio y así mejorar su calidad de vida. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
Ella ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa en el pasado y ha demostrado ser una cliente bastante responsable y puntual con sus pagos.
texts.en:
39-year-old Mercedes is married and has four children in her care.  She lives together with her family in the small village of Monteverde, a rural area of agricultural Tambogrande district.  This area has a tropical climate and is noted for its production of fruit such as mangoes and lemons.  The area is located in Piura region, five hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

For more than five years, Mercedes has been raising and selling livestock and farmyard birds.  She raises these animals in an area behind her home.  When they have fully grown, she offers them for sale.  Her husband is a farmer and has his own plot of land on which he grows mangoes and passion fruit. 

Mercedes would like to buy nutritionally-balanced feed with which to fatten her animals, so that she can fetch a better price for them in the local market.  This investment will allow her to continue growing in her business and therefore improve her quality of life.  In order to achieve her goal, Mercedes is requesting a loan for 2,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Mercedes has taken out loans from Edpyme Alternativa in the past and has shown herself to be a responsible client who is punctual in making her repayments.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally-balanced feed

loans.name: Joel Alberto

texts.es: Joel Alberto de 34 años de edad, habita junto a su  grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposa de 31 años y sus dos hijos de 9 y 3 años de edad. Él se dedica al comercio de pollos, huevos y bebidas. Con mucho esfuerzo y con la ayuda de Dios ha logrado mantener activo este negocio por varios años y es el que le ha permitido llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar, ya que su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar y ayuda un poco con el negocio por lo tanto no cuentan con otra entrada de ingresos. Él es un hombre increíble ya que para lograr vender sus productos, se vale de su bicicleta para comercializarlos en las comunidades más cercanas de su hogar. Tiene varios años de dedicarse a este negocio por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y con buenas referencias de sus vecinos. Posee algunos clientes fijos los cuales lo prefieren por ser un hombre honesto, carismático y responsable. Su sueño es dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida, esto es lo que lo motiva a trabajar duramente para poder cumplir su sueño ya que para él su familia es lo más importante. Todo esto lo ha llevado a tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de: pollos, huevos, bebidas, etc. de tal forma que esto ayude a atraer a más clientes y que cada vez su negocio sea más rentable y pueda lograr su sueño de dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
34-year-old Joel Alberto lives together with his family.  His family consists of his 31-year-old wife and his two children who are 9 and 3 years old.  His business is selling chickens, eggs and drinks.  With a lot of effort and God's help, he has managed to keep his business running for several years and this has enabled him to provide his household with their daily bread.  His wife takes care of the housework and helps a little with the business.  They do not have any additional source of income.

Joel Alberto is an incredible man because he uses his bicycle to sell his products in communities near his home.  He has been in this business for several years and already has a lot of experience and good references from his neighbors.  He has some regular customers who prefer to buy from him because he is an honest, charming and responsible man.  His dream is to provide his family with better living conditions.  This motivates him to work hard to  achieve his dream as his family are the most important thing in the world to him.

Joel Alberto decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL in order to invest in his business, buying chickens, eggs, drinks etc.  This will help him to attract more customers and make his business more profitable which will enable him to fulfill his dream of providing his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy chickens, eggs, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.en: Asunta, 30 years old, is married and has three children, all of them in school. She has operated a business selling charcoal in Yambio, South Sudan, for three years. Asunta is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is 29 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom attend school. She has a food stall in Yambio, South Sudan, which she has run for six years.

Sara is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan, which she will use to purchase onions and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions and beans.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 51-year-old businesswoman from Bungoma, Western Kenya. She is married to John and they have six children, aged 6 to 21 years old.

For the last 8 years, Beatrice has operated a boutique selling clothing and footwear. She makes a monthly income of KES 10,800. Beatrice is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy clothing and shoe stock for sale. Her profits will be channeled to clearing the loan and expanding the business. Her dream is to have her business succeed.

loans.use: To buy shoes and clothes for her boutique.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stocks of fresh fish for resale.

loans.name: Ida

texts.es: Ida, de 43 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es casada con William quien es empleado, vive en compañía de su esposo, sus 03 hijos, sus 02 nueras, y 02 nietos, habitando cómodamente su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Ida es la venta de comidas como juanes, pollos fritos, arroz chaufa y otros, para eso se instala todos los días en el frontis de su casa, donde pone sus mesitas y sillas y atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos y transeúntes, realizando esta actividad desde hace 10 años lográndose hacer conocida y solicitada por sus alimentos, atendiendo con la ayuda de sus nueras. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite contar con un ingreso económico para apoyarse y pagar los gastos de su hogar, además de contar con un buena demanda de comida ha logrado ver sus ganancias a diario, logrando ahorrarse un capital.  Ahora su plan es abrir un tienda de alquiler de motos, de esa manera incrementará sus ganancias. Este será el préstamo número 06 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido y responsables. Con el monto solicitado de 2500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas como arroz, azuzar aceites y demás productos.
texts.en:
Ida, age 43, is a hardworking and industrious woman who has tremendous desire to move forward. She is married to William, who is employed. Ida lives comfortably with her husband, three children, two daughters-in-law, and two grandchildren in a home of her own. She has a business selling food such as “juanes” (chicken and rice wrapped in banana leaves), fried chicken, fried rice, and other dishes. Ida sells in front of her house where she has set up small tables and chairs. She provides very friendly service to her customers, most of whom are neighbors and pedestrians. Ida has been in business for 10 years and has become well-known since her food is in demand. She manages the business with the help of her daughers-in-law. Ida enjoys this business because she is able to generate a financial income to support herself and help with the household expenses. As a result of the high demand for her dishes, she is able to see daily earnings and save up her capital. Now she plans to open a motorcycle rental shop so that she can increase her earnings.

This will be her sixth loan with the MFP organization. For this reason, she hopes that a small loan will enable her to accomplish her goals. In addition, Ida gets along well with her Communal Bank and considers them to be a united and responsible group. The amount of 2500 PEN that she requested will be invested in the purchase of ingredients for preparing her dishes such as rice, sugar, oil, and other items.

loans.use: to buy  rice, sugar, oil, and other items.

loans.name: Medardo Eleodoro

texts.es:
Medardo, de 63 años de edad, casado, padre de 11 hijos, de oficio taxista desde hace 11 años, vive en la ciudad de León.  El tenia 52 años cuando comenzó a trabajar como taxista  antes el se dedicaba a trabajar como agricultor sembraba ajonjolí, algodón , maní el heredo de su madre tierras pero el vendió parte del terreno que tenia  para comprar el taxi una casa para sus hijos . Su esposa trabaja vendiendo granos básicos al por menor. 
El solicita el crédito para darle mantenimiento  y comprar un juego de llantas para su taxi.  Pues necesita mantener en buen estado  su vehículo para ofrecer un buen servicio con seguridad y transportar a sus clientes  hasta su lugar de destino.  Uno de sus propósitos es comprar un vehículo mas moderno porque el que tiene esta algo viejo y hacer sentir a los clientes que viajan de manera segura y confortable
texts.en:
Medardo, 63, is married and the father of 11 children.  He’s been a taxi driver for 11 years.  He lives in the city of León.  He was 52 years old when he started working as a taxi driver.  He used to work as a farmer growing sesame, cotton and peanuts.  He inherited the land from his mother but sold part of it to buy the taxi and a house for his children.  His wife works selling basic grains at retail.

He’s asking for a loan to service the taxi and to buy a set of tires for it because he needs to keep his vehicle in good working order to offer a good, safe service to transport his customers to their destinations.  One of his goals is to buy a more modern vehicle because the one he has is a bit old so that he can make his customers feel more comfortable and safe on their trips.

loans.use: to buy a set of tires and to service his taxi.

loans.name: Martha Teresa

texts.es: Martha Teresa de treinta años de edad vive con su familia, ella posee una venta de ropa en una zona cercana a la localidad donde reside,  el lugar es muy concurrido de personas y últimamente ha tenido más demanda pues toda la ropa que comercia es de excelente calidad y la vende a precios realmente accesibles, además el servicio es inigualable; Martha es una mujer entregada a su labor, dispuesta a superarse y alcanzar todas sus metas, piensa que la felicidad y la constancia son la clave del éxito, quiere ver crecer su negocio y está dispuesta a trabajar duro para lograrlo por eso se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor pantalones, vestidos, faldas, camisas, entre otros. Martha Teresa tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Martha Teresa, 30, lives with her family.  She has a clothing sales business in a zone near where she lives.  The place is very heavily visited by people and lately demand has been more because all the clothes she sells are of excellent quality and her prices are truly accessible; besides, service in unequalled.  

Martha is a woman who is devoted to her work; she’s willing to improve herself and reach all her goals.  She believes that happiness and constancy are the keys to success.  She wants to see her business grow and is determined to work hard to accomplish this which is why she’s decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan that will make it possible for her to buy more clothes like pants, dresses, skirts and shirts, among others at wholesale.  Martha Teresa hopes that she will be able to provide her family with better quality of life this way.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Wendy Antonia

texts.es: Wendy Antonia de 26 años de edad, habita en casa familiar junto con sus 4 hermanos y su hija. Ella se dedica al comercio de pan, pupusas y tienda.  Wendy se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora ya que no deja pasar ninguna oportunidad. Tiene muchas ideas de negocio que poco a poco va poniendo práctica.  Tanto ella como sus hermanos luchan para salir adelante y aunque su madre está en EEUU y les ayuda un poco con los gastos del hogar no se atienen a eso, si no que buscan la forma de ganarse el pan de cada día por su cuenta. Para Wendy es muy importante tener activo su negocio ya que su sueño es dar a su hija una mejor calidad de vida en la cual pueda disfrutar de una buena educación y mejores oportunidades a las que ella no tuvo acceso. Esta es la razón por la que ha tomado la decisión de acercarse a INTEGRAL para solicitar este crédito, con el fin de invertir en sus negocios en la comprar de: arroz, frijoles, queso, chicharon, maíz, harinas, azúcar, leña y de mas productos que permitan dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y atraer a nuevos compradores. Confía en Dios todo poderoso que de esta manera logrará su sueño.
texts.en: Wendy Antonia is 25 years old. She lives in her family home along with her four brothers and her daughter. She is dedicated to selling bread, pupusas (type of pancake) and groceries. Wendy is characterized as being an entrepreneurial woman since she does let any opportunity pass. She has many business ideas that she gradually puts into practice. She and her brothers struggle to get ahead and, although her mother is in the USA and helps them a little with the bills, they don't count on it and they look for ways to earn the daily bread on their own. For Wendy, it is very important for her business to be active since her dream is to give her daughter a better quality of life in which she can enjoy a good education and better opportunities that she did not have access to. This is the reason why she has decided to approach INTEGRAL to request this loan with the goal of investing for her businesses in the purchase of rice, beans, cheese, pork rinds, maize, flour, sugar, wood and more products that allow her to give better service to her customers and attract new buyers. She trust in the all powerful Good that, in this way, she will achieve her dream.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, cheese, pork rinds, maize, flour, sugar, wood, etc.

loans.name: José Dagoberto

texts.es: El señor José Dagoberto de 38 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposa y tres hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando. El señor José se dedica al diseño y venta de ropa. Diseña diversidad de prendas de vestir como: faldas, pantalones, blusas, trajes, uniformes, etc. Es muy conocido en la zona ya que cuando de confección de ropa se trata él es el mejor. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos, razón por la cual muchas personas lo prefieren. El señor José se caracteriza por ser un hombre honesto, trabajador y dedicado en su trabajo. Tiene muchos deseos de superarse y dar a su querida familia una mejor calidad de vida. Para él lo más importante es que sus hijos estudien para que algún día puedan convertirse en profesionales y puedan tener acceso a mejores condiciones de vida. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en  su negocio en la compra de variedad de telas, hilos, elástico, tijeras, etc. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de dar un mejor servicio a los clientes de tal forma que esto le permita mejorar sus ventas y por consecuencia sus niveles de ingresos, de esta manera podría seguir dando a su familia el pan de cada día.
texts.en: José Dagoberto is 38 years old.  He lives together with his family in a house that he owns.  His family consists of his wife and his three children who are all in school.  José's business is designing and selling clothes.  He designs a range of clothes such as skirts, pants, blouses, suits, uniforms, etc.  He is very well known in his area because, when it comes to making clothes, he is the best.  He offers good quality and good prices which means that many people prefer to do business with him.  José is an honest, hard-working man who is committed to his work.  He has a great desire to do well and provide his beloved family with a better quality of life.  The most important thing, as far as he is concerned, is for his children to study so that they can become professionals some day and have access to better living conditions.  He has taken the decision to request this loan from INTEGRAL so that he can invest in his business, buying a variety of fabric, thread, elastic, scissors etc.  He is doing all this with the goal of providing a better service to his customers so that he can improve his sales and thereby his income level.  This will enable him to continue providing his family with their daily bread.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, scissors, etc.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela, 47 years old, is married to Elly and the mother of four children aged between 7 and 16 years old. The family lives in Migori, Western Kenya.

Pamela has operated a cereal sales business for the last 7 years, selling mainly maize cereals. She earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. Pamela is taking out her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more stocks of maize cereals. Pamela will use her profits to pay her children's school fees. Her dream is to become a prosperous businesswoman in Migori.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of maize cereals

loans.name: Ana Dolores

texts.es: Ana Dolores de 37 años de edad, reside en casa de su propiedad junto con su compañero de vida y su hijo el cual ya es mayor de edad. La señora Ana se dedica al comercio de café, pan dulce, pan con huevo, pan con frijoles, atol, etc. Tiene aproximadamente 11 años de dedicarse a este negocio y gracias a Dios y a su esfuerzo ha logrado mantenerlo activo y es el que le ha permitido llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar ya que los ingresos de su esposo no son suficientes para cubrir los gastos de las principales necesidades, las cuales cada vez son mayores. Es muy conocida en la zona ya que siempre ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos, para ella lo más importante es que sus clientes estén satisfechos con su servicio. La ubicación del negocio es muy estratégica ya que se encuentra en el centro de la ciudad donde ella reside, lugar que es muy concurrido y visitado. Últimamente ha estado notando que la demanda de sus ricos panes ha aumentado y muchas veces se queda escasa de producto. Esto la ha llevado a tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de insumos  (frijoles, pan dulce, pan francés, huevos, café, etc.) que le permitan cubrir una mayor demanda y de esta manera espera obtener mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
37-year-old Ana Dolores lives in a house that she owns together with her life partner and her adult son.  Her business is selling coffee, sweet bread, egg sandwiches, bean sandwiches, 'atol' (a corn-based hot drink), etc.  She has been in this business for approximately 11 years and, thanks to God and her own efforts, she has managed to keep it running.  This has allowed her to provide her household with their daily bread as her husband's income is not enough to cover the cost of their main necessities which become more and more expensive.  

Ana Dolores is very well known in her area as she always offers good-quality products at good prices.  As far as she is concerned, the most important thing is for her customers to be happy with her service.  Her business is in a very strategic location, in the city center, where she lives.  This area is very busy and has lots of visitors. 

Ana Dolores has recently noticed that the demand for her delicious breads has risen and she often runs out.  For this reason, she has taken the decision to request a loan from INTEGRAL, to invest in her business, buying supplies (beans, sweet bread, French bread, eggs, coffee, etc.) that will enable her to cope with higher levels of demand.  In this way, she hopes to make more income which will allow her to improve her own quality of life as well as that of her family.

loans.use: to buy beans, sweet bread, French bread, eggs, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris, se dedica a la venta de carne en las ferias.
Gracias a las capacitaciones que ha recibido, Margarita aprendió a manejar bien su negocio, aprendió a ahorrar, a ser puntual y responsable, agradece todo los préstamos que le dieron, ya que gracias a ellos pudo tener mas capital y así dar una mejor educación a sus hijos, recuerda que cuando su esposo se enfermo de gravedad, solo Finca le ayudó, eso nunca se olvida, las capacitaciones le ayudaron a poder valorarse como mujer y aprender a ser feliz con las cosas que tiene, ahora con el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en al compra de carne.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the 'Arco Iris' (Rainbow) community bank.  Her business is selling meat in open-air markets.

Thanks to the training that she has received, Margarita has learned to manage her business well.  She has learned to save, and to be punctual and responsible.  She is grateful for all the loans that she has been given because, thanks to them, she has had more capital available and been able to provide her children with a better education.  She recalls that when her husband became seriously ill, Finca were the only ones to help her.  She will never forget this.  The training that she has received has helped her to value herself as a woman and she has learned to be happy with what she has.  She will use the loan that she is requesting to buy meat.

loans.use: to buy meat

loans.name: Evelyn Yazaira

texts.es:
Evelyn se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para invertirlo en el negocio, comprando mercadería que sea muy necesaria para que los clientes no se deserten, su inversión será en productos de primera necesidad como aceite, sopas, pastas, pollo, embutidos, huevos, pan.
Ella espera que esta inversión sea favorable y le ayude para incrementar el negocio, ella manifiesta que el préstamo anterior fue un gran aporte, el cual ha mejorado su condición.
texts.en: Evelyn has decided to take out a new loan, to invest in her business.  She will buy merchandise that she really needs in order to prevent her customers going elsewhere.  Her investment will be in essential household products such as oil, soup, pasta, chicken, sausages, eggs and bread.  She hopes that this investment will be favorable and help her to increase her business.  She says that her previous loan was a great help and enabled her to improve her situation.

loans.use: to buy oil, soup, pasta, chicken, sausages, eggs and bread

loans.name: Celsa

texts.es: Celsa es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris, tiene 34 años, se dedica a venta de cereales en las ferias, es madre de 2 hijos, y socia de FINCA Perú desde hace dos años, ella siempre trabajó pero ahora con las enseñanzas de Finca aprendió como hacer un buen negocio, la manera correcta de cómo criar a sus hijos, también tiene un chacra y tiene ganados, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de cereales para la feria.
texts.en: Celsa is a member of the 'Arco Iris' (Rainbow) community bank.  She is 34 years old and her business is selling cereals at the open-air markets.  She has two children and has been a member of FINCA Peru for two years.  She has always worked but now, with training from FINCA, she has learned how to run a good business and how to raise her children correctly.  She also has a farm and livestock.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying cereals to sell at the market.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Legión, tiene 62 años de edad, es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace mas de 13 años, es conviviente y madre de 6 hijos de los cuales 5 son ya profesional y solo 1 tiene bajo su responsabilidad. Paulina, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes es su bodega, nos cuenta que comenzó cuando todavía daban préstamos en dólares, ella empezó con $50, así de a pocos empezó, gracias a los préstamos recibidos pudo comprar su terreno y educar a sus hijos que ahora son profesionales, también logró hacer su casa con sus ahorros, abrió su bodega, agradece a Finca por el apoyo que le dio y por la facilidad de préstamo que se le da, también por las capacitaciones que se les da que también es una ayuda, incluso invitó a su hija para que le vaya bien dice ella, ahora solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en su tienda en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leña, cerveza y otros, para que así pueda surtir su tiendita.
texts.en: Paulina is a member of the 'Legión' community bank.  She is 62 years old and has been a member of FINCA Peru for more than 13 years.  She lives with her partner and has six children.  Five of her children are already professionals and she only has one left in her care.  Paulina's business is selling groceries in her store.  She tells us that she started out with FINCA when they still gave out loans in dollars.  She started off with a $50 loan.  Thanks to the loans that she received, she was able to buy her own plot of land and educate her children who are now professionals.  She also managed to build her house with her savings and open her grocery store.  She is grateful to FINCA for the support that they gave her and for the ease of obtaining the loans.  She is also grateful for the training which they provide which is helpful.  Paulina even invited her daughter to join so that she will also do well.  Paulina is now requesting a loan which she will invest in buying merchandise for her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, firewood, beer, etrc. so that she can stock her small store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, firewood, beer, etc.

loans.name: Paula Nubia

texts.es:
Paula, de oficio agricultora y comerciante, se dedica  a la siembra desde los 18 años de edad , es casada , tiene 6 hijos , su nivel de educación es básico solo termino el tercer grado de la primaria . El trabajar como agricultora fue el oficio que le enseñaron sus padres desde joven y la iniciático de tener una pulpería fue iniciativa propia de querer mejorar sus ingresos ya que a veces las cosechas de hortalizas  son bajas ella vende lo que siembra en el mercado de  León . 
Ella realizo el crédito para compra de maíz, ya que es un producto que no siembra pero que es muy solicitado por sus clientes la temporada es apropiada para su comercialización y no quiere perder esta oportunidad. Ya que desea almacenar este producto cuando este escaso y poder vender a sus clientes  y así no les haga falta este producto. Tiene planes de ampliar su pulpería y sus areas de siembra de hortalizas.
texts.en:
Paula is both a farmer and a merchant; she’s been farming since she was 18 years old.  She’s married and has six children.  Her educational level is basic, she only finished third grade of elementary school.  Her parents taught her farming since she was very young and the idea of having a grocery store was her own initiative because she wanted to improve her income because sometimes the vegetable harvests were small.  She sells what she grows in the market in León.

She took out the loan to buy corn since it’s a product she doesn’t grow but which is very highly sought-after by her customers.  The season is appropriate for its commercialization and she does not want to lose this opportunity because she wants to store it for when it’s scarce and be able to sell it to her customers so that they won’t lack this product.  She has plans to enlarge her grocery store and her farmland.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Maria Susana

texts.es:
María, quiere un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio de las tortillas, comprara maíz y leña, para mantener y poder con mayor facilidad producir sus ventas.
Ella ha tenido un efecto positivo en el negocio después de la administración del préstamo, esto ha mejorado económicamente a su hogar, volviéndolo más solvente frente a las obligaciones, de la cual espera que tambien este nuevo préstamo le ayude para salir bien con los pagos.
texts.en: María would like a new loan to invest in her tortilla business.  She will buy corn and firewood so that she can keep her business running and produce her tortillas more easily.  Her previous loan produced positive results for her business which, in turn, improved her household finances.  She has become more solvent as regards her obligations.  She hopes that this new loan will also help her so that she can do well with her payments.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: Rosalina tiene 47 años de edad, esta emprendedora se dedica a brindar los servicios de comidas y además tiene la venta de mercadería en general esta idea  se emprende de tener su propia fuente de trabajo y para  sacar a sus hijos adelante y  apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Rosalina tiene experiencia en ambos negocios ya tiene sus clientes que la visitan por la calidad de servicio que le ofrece. Rosalina está solicitando financiamiento para invertir en el cafetín comprara arroz, frijoles, aceite, tortilla, carne de tipo, cuajada, verduras, variedad de frutas entre otros.
texts.en: Rosalina is 47 years old.  This entrepreneur provides a meal service.  She also sells general merchandise.  The idea came about as she wanted to have her own source of work, provide for her children, and support her husband with the household expenses.  Rosalina has experience in both of her businesses as she has customers who visit her for the quality of the service that she offers.  Rosalina is requesting this loan to invest in her cafe.  She will buy rice, beans, oil, tortillas, meat, curds, vegetables, a variety of fruit, and other products.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, tortillas, meat, curds, vegetables, a variety of fruit, etc.

loans.name: Diana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Diana tiene 22 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 01  hijo, vive en casa de sus padres, la cual está ubicada en el caserío San Martin, una zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima tropical caracterizado por la producción de frutas como el mango y el limón. La zona se encuentra ubicada en la región Piura, a cinco horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.
La actividad que desarrolla el titular es la venta de bodoques y gelatinas (golosinas refrescantes) en su domicilio donde atiende todos los días de la semana,  además también de dedica a la crianza de ganado menor y aves de corral en la parte posterior de su domicilio, con los ingresos que obtiene de estas actividades ella se encarga de sacar adelante a su hijo y a apoyar al sostenimiento de su familia.
Diana desea adquirir alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus animales y de ese modo venderlos a un mejor precio en el mercado local, esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio y así mejorar su calidad de vida. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
Ella ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa en el pasado y ha demostrado ser una cliente bastante responsable y puntual con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Diana’s 22 years old and a single mother of a son; she lives in her parents’ house located in San Martín, a rural zone in the agricultural Tambogrande District which has a tropical climate suited for fruit production like mangoes and lemons.  The zone is located in Piura Region five hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Region’s capital.

Her activity is selling “bodoques” and “gelatinas” (refreshing snacks) at home; she works every day of the week.  She also raises small farm animals and barnyard fowl in her back yard.  With income earned from these activities she’s able to raise her son and help support her family.

Diana wants to acquire nutritionally balanced feed to fatten up her animals so that she can sell them for better prices in the local market.  This investment will help her continue to grow in business thus improving her quality of life.  To reach her objective she’s thought it wise to request a 1000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.  She’s had prior loans with Edpyme Alternativa and she’s shown herself to be quite a responsible and punctual client with her payments.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José tiene 43 años de edad, es viudo y tiene 03 hijos. Vive en el caserío Cruce de Vega, una zona rural del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima tropical caracterizado por la producción de frutas como el mango y el limón. La zona se encuentra ubicada en la región Piura, a cinco horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.
Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores (ovejas y pavos), los cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local, esta actividad la desarrolla desde hace 15 años, además se dedica a la agricultura, pues tiene un lote de terreno agrícola en el cual cosecha limón y tamarindo. Eventualmente trabaja como peón en los fundos agrícolas de la zona. Con estas actividades trata de sacar adelante a su familia.
José desea adquirir alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus animales y de ese modo venderlos a un mejor precio en el mercado local, esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio y así mejorar su calidad de vida. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
El es un padre bastante trabajador y responsable, las personas que le conocen en la zona donde vive le tienen mucho cariño y estima.
texts.en:
José is 43 years old, a widower and has three children; he lives in Caserío Cruce de Vega, a rural zone in the agricultural Tambogrande District which has a tropical climate suited for fruit production like mangoes and lemons.  The zone is located in Piura Region five hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Region’s capital.

He raises small farm animals (sheep and turkeys) to sell.  When they reach ideal size and weight he sells them in the local market.  He’s been in this line of work for 15 years.  He also farms.  He has a piece of farm land where he grows lemons and tamarind.  Sometimes he works as a day laborer on the large agricultural haciendas in his zone.  He tries to support his family with these activities.

José wants to acquire nutritionally balanced feed to fatten up his animals so that they can be sold for better prices in the local market.  This investment will make it possible for him to continue growing in business thus improving his quality of life.  

To reach his objective he’s deemed it convenient to request a 1000 new sol loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa.  He is quite a responsible, hardworking father.  People who know him in the zone where he lives hold him in high esteem and affection.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 50-year-old married woman. She has 5 children, of whom 3 are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Juma and he works as a businessman.

Amina operates a dry fish selling business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for 4 years. Her primary customers are her neighbors and relatives. Amina's other source of income includes farming. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for her children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Amina will use the loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase more stock of dry fish for resale. Amina aspires to establish a retail shop in the future. She joined Yehu because it offers quality financial services.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of dry fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to prepare for the planting season by buying agricultural inputs (seeds, fertilizers etc).

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is a 33-year-old man. He is married with one son. He employed, however his salary is not enough to cover all his family's needs.
